title: Lumbridge Castle

properties.value: Lumbridge Castle is a large castle located in Lumbridge and home of Duke Horacio. The courtyard enclosed by the outer walls features two decorative fountains and two statues, one of an ancient king and one of an ancient hero. A short flight of three steps joins this to the castle's front entrance. Another entrance is behind the castle.

Lumbridge Castle is a large castle located in Lumbridge and home of Duke Horacio. The courtyard enclosed by the outer walls features two decorative fountains and two statues, one of an ancient king and one of an ancient hero. A short flight of three steps joins this to the castle's front entrance. Another entrance is behind the castle.

All Lumbridge Home Teleport and Lumbridge Teleport spells take players to the courtyard of the castle.

It is a popular location as many new players are here, as they spawn here after completing Tutorial Island. Players also respawn here after death, though players have the option to respawn in Edgeville by speaking to the Witch in the Edgeville jail cell or in the Ferox Enclave by speaking to Ferox and members have the option to either respawn here or in Falador after completing Recruitment Drive, or lastly, in Camelot after completing Knight Waves Training Grounds.

Ground floor1st floor[edit | edit source]

The ground floor[UK]1st floor[US] is home to various water sources, a Cooking range, various decorations such as a long table and many portraits, and two quests: Cook's Assistant and Recipe for Disaster. In order to use the range, players must finish Cook's Assistant. A single mind rune spawn can be found by the stairs on the southern side of the castle.

The Cook's Assistant and Recipe for Disaster quests can be started here by talking to the Cook in the kitchen on the main floor. A trapdoor in the kitchen leads down to a cellar containing bucket and knife spawns, and an entrance to the Dorgeshuun Mines.

1st floor2nd floor[edit | edit source]

The 1st floor[UK]2nd floor[US] is where Duke Horacio's bedroom is and where he spends much of his time. Players can start the Rune Mysteries quest by speaking with him. He also provides a free Anti-dragon shield to any player who has started the Dragon Slayer I quest. Sigmund, his advisor, is the starting point of The Lost Tribe. There is a Spinning wheel in the room next to Duke Horacio and the Crafting tutor. The spinning wheel is one of the most used spinning wheels in Old School RuneScape due to its proximity to the 2nd floor[UK]3rd floor[US] bank.

2nd floor3rd floor[edit | edit source]

The 2nd floor[UK]3rd floor[US] has a bank, which houses the only bank tutor. There is also 4 log spawns, great for beginners training Firemaking and Fletching.

Cellar[edit | edit source]

The cellar can be accessed by climbing down a ladder located in Lumbridge Castle's kitchen. Before either the Recipe for Disaster or The Lost Tribe quests, this floor has only a cabbage, two leather boots, a jug, a knife, and a bucket. After beginning the Recipe for Disaster quest, players will have access to the Culinaromancer's Chest, which includes a bank. Additionally, after the Lost Tribe quest, players gain direct access to the Lumbridge Swamp Caves.

Treasure Trails[edit | edit source]

  • Searching a crate in the cellar is the solution to a hard cryptic clue: You will need to under-cook to solve this one.

Personalities[edit | edit source]

  • Duke Horacio
  • Sigmund
  • Hans
  • Cook

Changes[edit | edit source]

Date Changes
24 March 2021
(update)

2021 Easter event: Gregg may be sometimes found in the kitchen with the Cook.

16 July 2015
(update)
  • The top two floors of the Lumbridge Castle tournament arena map have been removed to prevent players repeatedly going up and down the stairs to lengthen games.
  • Moved some invisible walls on the Lumbridge Castle Clan Wars map.
18 December 2014
(update)

Leaving Lumbridge castle via the back door with Zanik now triggers the correct cutscene.

6 November 2014
(update | poll)

The Lumbridge Castle now has a back door leading out of the kitchen.

9 October 2014
(update | poll)

The Lumbridge Castle grounds now have a rear entrance to allow for quicker access to the Lumbridge tree farming patch.

  • The cellar.

'''Lumbridge Castle''' is a large castle located in [[Lumbridge]] and home of [[Duke Horacio]]. The courtyard enclosed by the outer walls features two decorative fountains and two statues, one of an ancient king and one of an ancient hero. A short flight of three steps joins this to the castle's front entrance. Another entrance is behind the castle.

All [[Lumbridge Home Teleport]] and [[Lumbridge Teleport]] [[spells]] take players to the courtyard of the castle.

It is a popular location as many new players are here, as they [[Spawning|spawn]] here after completing [[Tutorial Island]]. Players also respawn here after [[death]], though players have the option to respawn in [[Edgeville]] by speaking to the Witch in the Edgeville jail cell or in the [[Ferox Enclave]] by speaking to [[Ferox]] and [[members]] have the option to either respawn here or in [[Falador]] after completing [[Recruitment Drive]], or lastly, in [[Camelot]] after completing [[Knight Waves Training Grounds]].

=={{FloorNumber|uk=0|caps=y|nohelp=y}}==
The {{FloorNumber|uk=0}} is home to various water sources, a [[Cooking]] [[range]], various decorations such as a long table and many portraits, and two quests: [[Cook's Assistant]] and [[Recipe for Disaster]]. In order to use the range, players must finish Cook's Assistant. A single mind rune spawn can be found by the stairs on the southern side of the castle. 

The [[Cook's Assistant]] and [[Recipe for Disaster]] [[quest]]s can be started here by talking to the [[Cook (Lumbridge)|Cook]] in the kitchen on the main floor. A trapdoor in the kitchen leads down to a cellar containing [[bucket]] and [[knife]] spawns, and an entrance to the [[Dorgeshuun Mines]].

=={{FloorNumber|uk=1|caps=y|nohelp=y}}==
The {{FloorNumber|uk=1}} is where [[Duke Horacio]]'s bedroom is and where he spends much of his time. Players can start the [[Rune Mysteries]] [[quest]] by speaking with him. He also provides a free [[Anti-dragon shield]] to any player who has started the [[Dragon Slayer I]] quest. [[Sigmund]], his advisor, is the starting point of [[The Lost Tribe]].
There is a [[Spinning wheel]] in the room next to Duke Horacio and the [[Crafting tutor]]. The spinning wheel is one of the most used spinning wheels in ''Old School RuneScape'' due to its proximity to the {{FloorNumber|uk=2}} [[bank]].

=={{FloorNumber|uk=2|caps=y|nohelp=y}}==
The {{FloorNumber|uk=2}} has a [[bank]], which houses the only [[bank tutor]]. There is also 4 [[logs|log]] spawns, great for beginners training [[Firemaking]] and [[Fletching]].

==Cellar==
The cellar can be accessed by climbing down a ladder located in Lumbridge Castle's kitchen. Before either the [[Recipe for Disaster]] or [[The Lost Tribe]] quests, this floor has only a [[cabbage]], two [[leather boots]], a [[jug]], a [[knife]], and a [[bucket]]. After beginning the Recipe for Disaster quest, players will have access to the [[Culinaromancer's Chest]], which includes a [[bank]]. Additionally, after the Lost Tribe quest, players gain direct access to the [[Lumbridge Swamp Caves]].

==Treasure Trails==
*Searching a crate in the cellar is the solution to a hard [[cryptic clue]]: ''You will need to under-cook to solve this one.''

==Personalities==
*[[Duke Horacio]]
*[[Sigmund]]
*[[Hans]]
*[[Cook (Lumbridge)|Cook]]
